metadata.title: CVE-2024-24684 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the readOFFfunctionality of libigl v2.5.0. A specially crafted .off file can lead tostack-based buffer overflow. An attacker can provide a malicious file totrigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability concerns the header parsingoccuring while processing an `.off` file via the `readOFF` function. We cansee above that at [0] a stack-based buffer called `comment` is defined withan hardcoded size of `1000 bytes`. The call to `fscanf` at [1] is unsafeand if the first line of the header of the `.off` files is longer than 1000bytes it will overflow the `header` buffer.

criterions.comment: slic3r-prusa package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
